Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute over trademark registration validity
Legal_Issue: Whether the Registrar's decision to maintain the OX & PALM trademark was reasonable under section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Stage: Appeal from Registrar's decision; judicial review by Federal Court
Evidence_Assessment: Heinz registered the mark and sold products to a Canadian distributor within the relevant three-year period; delivery occurred slightly after the period
Decision_Outcome: Application to expunge the trademark denied
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant seeking expungement to show non-use
Credibility_Factor: Registrar accepted Heinz's evidence of use through distribution chain
Legal_Rule: Section 45 requires use in Canada during three years or justification for non-use due to special circumstances
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-use of the OX & PALM trademark in Canada
Outcome_on_Merits: Registrarâ€™s decision upheld; trademark remains registered
Decision_Maker: Registrar of Trademarks, reviewed by Federal Court
Key_Evidence_Considered: Sales to Canadian distributor during relevant period
Applicant_Challenge: Attempt to expunge OX & PALM registration for non-use
Defendant_Response: Heinz demonstrated use through authorized distribution in Canada
Remedy_Requested: Expungement of OX & PALM trademark registration
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative review followed by judicial review
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, Federal Court of Canada
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark in Canada for three consecutive years
